content: wee ashley wee ashley cardyand wee morrie bonnet in white gum wool 8ply ethical merino gum grey knit and photographed by kelly van niekerk wee ashley is a unisex cardigan pattern for babies one size only small newborn to fit a baby approximately 2 8kg -3 5kg in birthweight page 1 written for 8ply/dk weight yarn wee ashley pattern information construction needles wee ashley has you cast on at the neckline and 3 5mm and 4 0mm needles work flat forming a rounded garter neckline the or size required to obtain gauge plus one 2 sizes smaller upper chest upper back and top half of the sleeves this knit can be worked entirely on flat knitting needles are all worked flat in one piece utilising raglan however instructions are provided to work the sleeves in the shaping until a specific stitch count is obtained round if choosing to work in the round you will need double pointed needles or a long circular needle for working the small from here the arm stitches are put onto waste yarn circumference sleeves in the round or a stitch holder and the body finished even if knitting the sleeves flat the small number of stitches once the body is completed the sleeves are removed may be more comfortable worked back and forth on a flexible from waste yarn and returned to the needles cable circular needle instructions are provided for working the sleeves both in the round and flat notions you will need to know how to 6 stitch markers backwards loop cast on for beneath the arms tape measure knitting in the round optional darning needle for sewing in ends seaming & buttons knitting top-down raglans scissors long tail cast on for initial cast on picking up stitches for beneath the arms abbreviations seaming optional k - knit if you are not familiar with these techniques you k2tog - knit 2 stitches together a decrease kfb - knit into the front and back of a stitch may need to reference a knitting guide book or an increase view videos on the internet p - purl sl1p - slip 1 stitch as if to purl gauge yo - yarn over an increase in this instance used to create 22 stitches & 28 row/10cm on 4 0mm needles a buttonhole in stocking stitch blocked to achieve fit as per pattern it is important to achieve the sizing stitch gauge the row gauge is not as important as lengths are provided in body length = 21cm the pattern to knit to rather than a specific number of row from top of shoulder to cast off edge yarn requirements 8ply/dk weight yarn 200-250m/100g this pattern is suitable for yarn with good elasticity and sleeve length = 11cm memory a wool or wool blend from underarm to cast off suggested yarn edge white gum wool ethical superfine merino 8ply body circumference = 36 5cm 236m/100g gum grey 1 skein approximately 1 5cm positive ease visit www whitegumwool com
